And after sampling flavor after delectable flavor, I ended up buying more than I could possibly give away. Which is fine because now there are more for me.

So yes, I've learned a valuable lesson here. Don't judge a book by it's cover. Forget that there is absolutely no curb appeal here whatsoever. These little nuggets of heaven stand up all on their own.
author: Bella B.

description: Unbelievable. Do not come here. The staff does not care for you at all! I ordered a truffle, paid, and when the man handed it to me, it dropped. I was not given another truffle, but was told I needed to purchase another one and "there was nothing he could do about it." I'd go to Walgreens for a truffle than come here again.
author: Kimmy K.

description: Great truffles, friendly staff. Stop in for a box or a single piece!
author: K. C.

description:
They are FABULOUS.  And only 50 cents:  AWESOME!!!!

Don't let the look of this place fool you. Its all about the chocolate and all about my wallet so I'm all about Five Star.
author: Daryl D.

description:
Simply put I know most everything about chocolate. I work for an unamed company that incorperates VERY high end chocolate, so basicaly I have had chocolate from all over the world(made and growen) and I must say i was very happy with these truffles. These truffles are not the best but they are really good, and for the pirce(0.50 a pice), i will most definatly go back, but dont tell my boss, he Hates that i eat chocolate from other places.

by the way the coffee here is pritty good!
author: David P.

description: These guys learned their craft at XOX in North Beach.  The truffles here taste just as good.  It is conveniently located near to where we get our car serviced and washed, so we stop by a few times a year.
author: David H.

description: What's not to love about .65 cent truffles!?  These are pillow like rich and creamy and decadent truffles; These truffles require no chewing; just melting.  Some of my favorites: raspberry, caramel, and lemon.  I really want a sea salt and Meyer lemon.  Such a low key place with wondrous truffles at a non-big city price.  Such a nice treat for body and soul--Five Stars truly is a Five Star.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description: 100% addictive truffles, made on the spot by the owner, who is super sweet.  Completely low-key place with truffles, coffee and a couple of tables.  I only tried the strawberry and the caramel and can't wait to go back to try the other flavors.
author: Kristen N.

description: I love this place.  Best hot chocolate, amazing truffles at an unbelievable price, and no snootiness.
author: Tamsen S.

description: Easily one of the most accurately named places in the city!  I've now tried 5 different types of their freshly-made truffles, and they are all fantastic.  Seriously, next time you are in the dog-house, stop by, buy the lady some truffles, and prepare to reap the rewards when you get home.
author: Matthew H.

description:
I like this place and hope they do well. I found their prices very reasonable and the guy even cut me a deal since I was buying a bunch for a large party. I think the inside and the packaging could use a big makeover and it doesn't make me want to linger, but I'm there for the chocolate which is delicious. 
I checked it out before I knew about the whole "recipe stealing" drama, but I have to say, I don't really get it. I can't speak to the lying part, and if true, I wouldn't like being lied to either. But, I worked in high-end restaurant kitchens for 10+ years and I can't even count all the sous' to come and go, stealing techniques and exact recipes, and taking them to other places. A lot of guys skip culinary school altogether and simply apprentice in a bunch of kitchens with the express purpose of picking up things along the way. It's an open secret in the food biz and everyone knows it (that's why some places have their sous' sign non-competes or won't give recc letters unless you've been there for at least a year-- XO was lucky to have this guy for 3+). And why does he need someones "blessing" to start his own place? I've noticed more local artisanal coffee roasters popping up with the success of Blue Bottle. Are we really supposed to boycott them too if their roasters learned recipes and techniques from BB? Anyways, I personally don't think XO has much to worry about given their high-profile, friendly service and much cuter ambiance, but if Five Star can provide a similar product at a lower price more power to them.
author: C R.

description: OK, I really try not to eat too many sweets. But this is my idea--I buy 5 Star Truffles for OTHER PEOPLE. And the fellow behind the counter always gives me a bonus truffle to sample. And...I've noticed that you can peal off the sticker of the box and sneak another truffle or two out and seal it back up before presenting it to the recipient of your generous gift and no one is the wiser. Definitely worth the subterfuge. These little gems are fabulous.
author: Donna B.

description: I have never actually been in this place, but as soon as I see that little chinese food to go box full of chocolate truffles, my face lights up! I absolutely love these little guys and could eat 15 in a row (which I probably did the first time my boyfriend brought them home). Once I was enlightened to the price of each truffle, I learned to savor them a bit more. Truthfully, they are worth every penny. My favorites include the cayenne pepper, raspberry, and hazelnut.
author: Julia T.

description: I tried walking past without going in, but the smell of the caramel was too yummy. It's 10:41 a.m. and I am having Earl Grey truffles for breakfast.
author: Karlee D.

description: Okay so maybe these guys were just having an off day when I came in.  I dunno...I'm a sweets fiend and I just didn't think the dark chocolate truffle I had was exciting.  Maybe I should have gone for a more exotic flavor.  My iced mocha was pretty terrible too.  It was gritty, watery, and just lacked flavor in general.  They get one star because it's a default, one star for a free truffle with every coffee purchase and one star for having super cheap truffles.  Let's face it, I've got two birthday girls this weekend and no ideas so I can buy them each a gazillion truffles at 50 cents a piece and I don't have to eat them.
author: Jill D.

description: Went in for a cup of coffee not knowing a thing about the place or its truffles--or apparently the bitter chocolate truffle feud, but Santos gave me a free truffle with my cafe Americano, so I choose the coconut and that was all I needed to be hooked like a crack whore. Damn it was great with my coffee. I left the place with a variety of 40 truffles for a party I am having this weekend--now all my friends will be hooked too. Sharing is caring, so go and try a truffle and see for yourself.
author: Deborah S.

description:
who me?  truffles?  what?  i don't have any!  i don't know what you're talking about!  ridiculous!.... oh that?  around my mouth you say?  *lick* ....oh um....yeah i fell in on my face in some dirt while hiking...with zeus...um i mean he just totally dug his face in dirt and licked me all over...*smack*....what?  what's that?  i look like i'm having an orgasm you say?.....oh?....ohhhh....ohhhh...ohhhh!!!

yeah.  truffles good.  $7.50 per box good.  owner very sweet.  me likey.
author: Josie M.

description: Yes, the truffles are amazing - but lets not forget the other 1/2 of the business name - I had one of the best lattes in my life there this weekend AND I got a free truffle with it.
author: Lisa B.

description: A few months ago I decided to try all of the truffles available and I have to say that the dark chocolate and caramel truffles are the absolute best! Consistently great truffles! And...for the holiday season, the nice staff can prepare truffle gifts in boxes with a ribbon to finish it off.
author: Ileana H.

description: Tasty tiny truffles! At fifty cents a pop, it's no trouble to buy a handful of these. You can get one free with a coffee drink, but I've gotta warn you, the dollar coffee is of the dishwater sort. So buck up, get a latte and pop a truffle in yo' mouf.
author: Nick D.

description:
caramel truffle.

try one and sit down. no driving. it is completely intoxicating.

sit.

and it does feel like a corner store, bare, but they are brand spanking new, probably without the funds to splurge on decor.

good people, good truffles, good for me....
author: Walrus C.

description: Yelp to the rescue again.  This time I find an awesome new truffle store in my neighborhood and a painless way to take care of office holiday gifts.  The "regiftability" potential is admittedly low (how thoughtless of me), but I can't imagine that'll be much of an issue with these delectable morsels.  The variety of flavors in insane, with the earl gray.truffle being a worthy choice among many.
author: Leon R.

description:
I understand the frustation some of you are expressing about the supposed "stealing" of recipes and business idea, but you can't patent an idea like coffee and truffles - plenty of people could have thought of it.  And if you say the truffles taste different than I guess they're not the same recipes.  There are lots of recipes out there for truffles.   I for one would never make a trip over to North Beach just for truffles, but if I'm there I'll stop in XOX for one.  Five Star is far away from North Beach, so I find it hard to believe that they're stealing any business from XOX.  So, I think you should cut this guy a break.  He's trying to start a business with what he knows best - making truffles.  Plenty of pastry chefs learned from and got ideas and recipes from other pastry chefs, then took those ideas to their new jobs.  I don't really see the difference here.

Bottom line: the truffles are yummy, the coffee is good, the place is unpretentious & a great spot to go in while getting my car washed.
author: Heidi S.

description:
yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum.

and at 50 cents a pop, you can yum yum yum yourself all the way home. or at least through the panhandle.
author: Bee H.

description: This place is amazing! I walked in there and the owner was cooking caramel! You could smell it outside. Every truffle I have tried has been to die for... of course caramel is the best (and black and white). Not to mention you get a free one with every cup of coffee. LOVE this place
author: Katie P.

description:
Considering five star truffles is my facebook interest, I love this place.  I've been going to them since he opened the store.  The owner is the sweetest man who always has a smile on his face and even showed me how to make truffles.  The truffles are to die for and coffee is great and cheap.

I love giving this place my business!    Go!
author: Alysa T.

description: What an absolute pleasant surprise.  I was so happy that I found parking in the hood 20 minutes prior to my appointment at skin city...I walked into the shop to have a cup of coffee and then Santos, gave me a free truffle to go along with my coffee (what a score!).  It immediately melted in the mouth.  The coco on the outside of the truffle was the perfect amount of bitter to offset the creamy sweet inside.   Then I immediately thought about  serving them at my party.  Within the first hour of the party, all 40 truffles gone! Completely wiped out! I'm pretty sure that that someone licked the bowl.  Nice going Santos!  I'll be back for more:)
author: Valarie A.

description: No more Mitchells! Instead, there are different types of hot drinking chocolates! The newly painted walls also make the place look much nicer!
author: Judy L.

description: The interior of the place looks like a ghetto taqueria.  The truffles are the size of a quarter.  Don't go here if you're expecting Godiva-sized truffles!  BUT I HAVE TO GIVE THIS PLACE CREDIT FOR THEIR.......CARAMEL TRUFFLES.  Downed a whole take-out box of these little delectable babies and it sure made my soul smile, hehe.  Especially because they were so cheap!
author: Joellene B.

description: I thought my BF was joking when he asked me if I wanted coffee and a truffle on divis, B.B. is right--this place has zero curb appeal, which makes it even better! Sweet service, the caramel is super creamy, the earl gray delicious, and the hazelnut covered in a fine coating of mmmmm.
author: Sita B.

description: Wow!! My husband and I walked into this place to get a quick coffee and was pleasantly surprised to say the least. The man behind the counter (maybe the owner?) was incredibly friendly as he served up tasty coffee for a whopping $1.00. My husband ordered a latte -also tasty, and we ordered two truffles. THE TRUFFLES WERE FREE BECAUSE WE ORDERED COFFEE!! You can order 80 truffles for a measly $30. The service, the coffee and the truffles were all fantastic and I'm definitely going back.
author: kristen v.

description: This rating is based on the coffee service ONLY.  I've been walking past this place and noticing "Free Truffle with Coffee" - so, I go order a coffee and I'm told "Sorry, no decaf today."  I figured they were out, so waited a couple of days and tried again.  The guy said "Well, we have decaf coffee but don't have a machine to grind it" . . .HUH?  Why would a coffee specialty shop have no grinder?  Is that weird??  The owner is seriously lacking in some basics here.  Sorry 5-Star, until you get your coffee act together you're in the doghouse!
author: Barbara B.

description: I had the earl gray, caramel and dark chocolate truffles and it was awesome. I also got a tasty soy cappuccino to go with adding a nice contrast. The owner was super warm and gracious. Great little get away while getting your car washed at Touchless Divisidero.
author: Sanaz E.

description:
i recently moved a few blocks from Five Star Truffles, and happened to be walking by one day and though they looked suspiciously like XOX Truffles in my old hood, North Beach.  lo and behold, after chatting w/ the owner (Santos, nicest guy ever...and hardworking) i found that he had worked at XOX for years.  however, he assured me that his formula was different, better, and thankfully, CHEAPER (for us chocoholics...).   

tho the decor leaves a little to be desired, who the f*ck cares when i'm staring at a refrigerator case full of tiny nuggets of chocolatey goodness!  their caramel is my #1 fave, followed closely by the earl grey.  and you get a free one w/ every order of truffles or a cup of coffee.  i actually got 2 free ones last time!  OH JOY!

where else can you get homemade, fresh, beautiful, yummy truffles from a local business at 20 for $7.50?   yes, do the math, that's 37.5 cents a piece!  or 50 cents for one - i say buy in bulk!  they last in the fridge for a few months.  a nice thing to offer your guests!

we gotta keep them in the neighborhood...how about some local artists go in there and offer to help him spruce up his walls in exchange for selling their art???
author: Suzanne A.

description: Pretty awesome. I've only had truffles once before just to give you all full disclosure and these were far better. Good prices since you can get truffles which are way better than see's candy boxes, they are cheaper, and the come in a box that looks like you just got back from a thai place.
author: Eric E.

description: 5 stars indeed...  I used to be one of the few people in my little world who didn't like dark chocolate, but I sure love it now, especially the caramels and the earl grey truffles from this place.  Service is friendly, and the free sample is a nice touch.  The really bad thing is that I want to go here and get a box of 20 pretty much every weekend, and that is something I really don't need to do.  I know where I'm getting my holiday gifts this year, folks...
author: robyn s.

description: Stumbled across this place the other day. A couple "D"elicious truffles stumbled into my mouth. Kept on stumbling.
author: Shane B.

description: I hope my brother isn't right when he said he read somewhere that this place was closing down... sigh.. went for a car wash and decided to walk into Five Star - and WOW, I do love their truffles. i'm pretty sure we bought 20 truffles two days ago and we only have two now. Addictive and flavorful, hopefully they'll still be there next time I show up! (Favorites: hazelnut, cayenne (beware the kick!), any liquor....)
author: Jeannette L.

description:
gave me a sample right off the bat (I chose vegan dark chocolate):  two stars.
had VEGAN truffles for my lactose-intolerant sister: two more stars
offered me a taster of a second flavor on my way out the door (flavor: black & white): two more stars.
Conclusion: six stars.
author: Rachel S.

description: Umm... five stars? The homemade, super cheap truffles are delicious! They always throw in a few more than you order and give a free sample. Don't bother with the coffee though, it's terrible. Just eat some more truffles.
author: Leah C.

description: This is  a super car busy intersection, but there's a parking lot that oddly enough is under used and pretty easy to access. This means there should be nothing stopping you from getting some of these delicious treats.  It's not real showy, but it's clean and very straight forward: glass case and a note... very good thing.  The place is like the neighborhood: a secret pocket of goodness and the owner's don't get much nicer. I recommend it, it's nice.
author: jesse l.

description: It's alright.....the size of the trufflles are uneven, you can't tell which one is earl grey or what .... some are half domed some are nugget looking... unattractive. The flavor is there but can't compare it to a high end- made by a Chef. Looks like rejects from a restaurant....  I'm not surprise if it's cheap....the quality is lower but a quick fix for a low price.
author: freewill m.

description: in my neighborhood of countless coffee shops, i eschew all others specifically to come here.  and i'm not the only one, as this establishment draws a line of caffeine-starved patrons eagerly awaiting its opening each morning (despite the presence of several other coffee-purveyors less than a block away).  the owner is sweet and little excites me more than, after handing over my cup of morning (or afternoon. or evening.) coffee, which is always tasty, he asks me "Would you like a chocolate?"  Because I get one free with every cup of coffee.  And hell yes, I would like a chocolate.
author: Dani B.

description: The caramel truffles are AMAZING!!! I love this place and totally want to support it - but I usually struggle wtih how many truffles does a girl *really* need... I need to start buying these and giving them to all my friends :)
author: sara m.

description: This place is classic SF... before all of the "gentrification" that everyone loves to complain about.  It's small, virtually un-decorated, and honestly not terribly appealing... and I mean that all in the best way!  I'm not sure I'd hang out there and eat truffles and drink coffee, but get a box to go and you'll be in heaven.  The Earl Grey ones are amazing, but I didn't find any that I didn't love, honestly.  It's so refreshing to see truffles as they are supposed to be... lumpy, small... I know that doesn't SOUND good, but it is!  Almost without exception, desserts that look amazing don't taste amazing, due to all the cornstarch and gelatin and crap that makes them look shiny and nice.  Truffles were originally named for their appearance, and has anyone seen an actual truffle lately?  Ugly little buggers.  So, to wrap this up.. go support this little guy in the chocolate world because he's genuine and kind, his chocolates are genuine and down to earth, and they are trying to make it in a world where "genuine" is a rare word to use.
author: Jennifer P.

description: oh crap.  delicious chocolates available on the way to my girlfriend's house.  cheap delicious chocolates.  my attempt to eat less sweets is dangerously close to failing.
author: Peter H.

description: um. yum. will update review when i actually come into the store (have been avoiding an in-person visit in an effort to keep a well proportioned booty. my friend snuck a box into my fridge. cute lil smallish thank GOD chinese take out box filled with truffle delights. these were bite-sized dark choco truffles filled with the most divine caramel and dusted with bitter cocoa powder. heaven. plowed through them in 5 days. not bad! love you mean it.
author: Mary V.

description: The truffles here are to die for.  I tried the hazelnut and caramel truffles and experienced a fabulous taste explosion in my mouth!  The storefront could use some help....we walked into a swarm of flies and it looked more like a donut shop. For a chocolate shop, I think it should have a more polished look. And they could use help with packaging for take away orders...they use chinese fortune cookie boxes.  I'd love to get a box to give as a gift, but I'd have to repackage them before giving it away!
author: Kelly M.

description: This place is ghetto, but the truffles are indisputably good. Pick up a box of 20 to go and pop them in your refrigerator. You even get a free sample with your purchase. They will last a while, or as long as you and your fat ass roommates can resist popping every last one into your mouths.
author: M. W.

description: been going here since i lived in this hood, four years ago. their chocolates are bar none and their sampler boxes make the best holiday gifts. although, i hear chase bank wants to move in and put up a branch.   :(  just another reason to hate chase. as if there weren't enough reasons already....
author: abby c.

description: nearly identical to xox truffles, just as good, and an alternative location that may make it more convenient for other people who dont especially want to go to north beach.
author: christopher a.

description: The truffles are delicious and the service friendly (owner operated).   This is the kind of shop I would go out of my way to support.
author: Liz M.

description: best hot chocolate and mochas... our new favorite, good stop while getting your car washed too
author: Thomas B.
